instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message:
System chimes.
No Backlight.
No Image.
No Keyboard
No Trackpad? (can't really test)
Fan runs high.

Lots of corrosion around <CAPACITOR>C4020</CAPACITOR>, <CAPACITOR>C4021</CAPACITOR>, <RESISTOR>R4052</RESISTOR> (WLan).

Replaced and leaned it up but no change in behaviour. I can hear a chime but cannot perform a PRM reset, even with a known good keyboard and trackpad.


Should I get a chime with no ssd installed?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> = 3.41

Trackpad connector looks good. The whole board looks really good except for that one spot around <CAPACITOR>C4020</CAPACITOR>.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message:
PP3v3 @ <CAPACITOR>C9009</CAPACITOR>::1 is 2v

It should be 3v right?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message: Of course it should be 3.3V. Guess a trace is fucked or 3V S3 FET.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR>::1 == 3v3
<RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR>::2 == 2v0

So would this imply S3 FET is okay and something is pulling it down on the outside of <RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR>?

How can I measure a resistor that is rated at 1/10w?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message: <RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR> is dead of course. Something fried it, so check for short on 3V S3 rail.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Chimes, no backlight, no image, no keyboard.
threads.message:
Removed <RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR> and couldn't find a short on the ::2 side.

Replaced with a fresh new <RESISTOR>R7811</RESISTOR> and everything is happy again.

Mark solved please.
